oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: UNICEF tour - Tokyo, Japan - 1972 - part 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part five of a 1972 UNICEF fundraiser tour performance in Tokyo, Japan at Budo Kahn Hall. Featuring Tex Ritter (host/performer), Tom T. Hall (performer), and an interview with Tom T. Hall conducted by Bruce Reynolds (announcer/interviewer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tom T. Hall; Tex Ritter
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Tex Ritter introduces Tom T. Hall -- (00:55) Ballad Of Forty Dollars (Tom T. Hall) -- (03:53) Tom T. Hall thanks the audience and introduces the band -- (05:00) Shoeshine Man (Tom T. Hall) -- (07:35) Tom T. Hall talks -- (07:52) Me And Jesus (Tom T. Hall) -- (10:57) The Year That Clayton Delaney Died (Tom T. Hall) -- (13:40) Tex Ritter thanks Tom T. Hall and announces a 10 to 15 minute intermission -- (14:45) FEN (Far East Network) news bumpers and reports -- (19:50) Bruce Reynolds talks with Tom T. Hall -- (20:09) Tom T. Hall talks about this being his as well as many others first time performing and being in Japan -- (20:32) Hall talks about the Japan's show attendance being close to 9,000 people, the largest so far on the tour -- (20:46) Hall talks about many of the audience members in New Zealand being thrilled to be at a country music show, some having traveled over 150 miles to be there -- (21:25) Hall talks about his experience in Europe and how country music is spreading far and wide -- (22:00) Hall talks about some of the performers on the ticket in London -- (22:43) Hall talks about the first annual Fan Fair in Nashville -- (23:50) Hall talks about how much money is going into CMA fest -- (24:28) Hall talks about the old Opry house closing down -- (25:15) Hall gives his opinion on where country music is headed -- (26:20) Hall talks about modern country music and recording techniques -- (27:00) Hall talks about lyrical content of real country music -- (27:25) Reynolds concludes the interview -- (27:32) John Kinney concludes the intermission, and confirms the crowd size at 9,000 attendees -- (28:43) Bruce Reynolds introduces Tex Ritter -- (29:08) The Wayward Wind (Tex Ritter) -- (30:50) Hillbilly Heaven (Tex Ritter)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: UNICEF.; Hall, Tom T.; Ritter, Tex, 1905-1974;
